Using TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100 driver.

To reproduce:
- Create a datapool with two equivalence classes
- On the overview tab, remove the first equivalence class
- Go the equivalence class tab, and try to remove or add record
The results of the actions are not visible unless you enforce a refresh (go to the overview tab and then back to the equivalence class tab).
If the user removes twice the same record, then an exception is thrown:

org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException: index=1, size=0
at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.add(BasicEList.java:638)
at org.eclipse.hyades.models.common.datapool.impl.DPLEquivalenceClassImpl.insertRecordDoNotNotify(DPLEquivalenceClassImpl.java:288)
at org.eclipse.hyades.models.common.datapool.impl.DPLEquivalenceClassImpl.insertRecord(DPLEquivalenceClassImpl.java:258)
at org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui.datapool.internal.control.DatapoolTable.insertRowAfter(DatapoolTable.java:1735)
at org.eclipse.hyades.test.ui.datapool.internal.control.DatapoolTable.addRow(DatapoolTable.java:1721)
Note that it is not a regression, it is reproductible on a 4.2.2 TPTP driver.
